instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No video.
threads.message: I restored 3V42 and the board is booting now but it's not putting out any video/backlight. Thunderbolt external video is fine. Boots normally to desktop. I'm using a known-good test screen. Flashlight through the back gives me nothing. I'm attaching pre-ultrasonic pics. It's pretty obvious where it got hit. Not sure where to go with this one.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No video.
threads.message: Getting 5V to L8300 for a short while during power on? I see crap around <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> which controls all that, check the enables there. <RESISTOR>R8341</RESISTOR> also looks sad..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - No video.
threads.message: Just cleaned up, added solder and reflowed the <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> area and it's good now. Thanks for the tips.
